title: Verify when value for disable.capacity.for.non.inventoried.events is set to true in application properties

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PVNG application
2. Login to the Application using valid credentials
3. Verify the 
disable.capacity.for.non.inventoried.events in 
application properties is defaulted to true
4. 1. Select Ticketing Setup tab
2. Select Event Administration tab
3. Search for the Non-Inventoried event and select it
5. 1. Select the Capacity Control tab
2. Select 'Non-Inventory' from the Set Capacity 
For dropdown
3.Verify the capacity limit text box is displayed 
and user is not able to add capacity control for 
the Price Scale
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PVNG application should launch successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. User should be able to verify the same
4. Event details should be displayed
5. Capacity limit text box is displayed and user is not 
able to add capacity control for the Price Scale

title: Verify that the default value for disable.capacity.for.non.inventoried.events is set to false for non-inventoried event

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PVNG application
2. Login to the Application using valid credentials
3. 1. Select Ticketing Setup tab
2. Select Event Administration tab
3. Search for the Non-Inventoried event and select it
4. 1. Select the Capacity Control tab
2. Select 'Non-Inventory' from the Set 
Capacity For dropdown
3.Verify the capacity limit text box is 
displayed and user is able to add capacity 
control for the Price Scale
5. Verify the 
disable.capacity.for.non.inventoried.events in 
application properties is defaulted to false
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PVNG application should launch successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. Event details should be displayed
4. Capacity limit text box is displayed and user is 
able to add capacity control for the Price Scale
5. User should be able to verify the same

title: Verify return from multi offer order of non-inventoried event when capacity limit is reached

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Pre-requisite:
1. Create a non-inventoried events  and set capacity limit
2. Launch the PV application
3. Navigate to Ticket Sales, sell the non-inventoried event
4. Lock seats for  the non-inventoried event so that capacity limit is reached. complete sale transaction 
and checkout.
5. In Ticket Services, return a seat from both the offers
6. Verify the capacity control tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Application is launched successfully
3. 
4. Qty Sold/Reserved : capacity limit reached
5. User should be able to return
6. Qty Sold/Reserved will be reduced by the number of tickets returned

4.

6. In Ticket Services, return a seat from both non-inventoried event
7. Verify the capacity control tab

4.

6. User should be able to return
7. Qty Sold/Reserved will be reduced by the number of tickets returned

title: Verify return from Package order if Package contains an invetoried and non-inventoried Package list and capacity limit is reached

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Pre-requisite:
1. Create an inventoried event 
2. Create a non-inventoried event  and set capacity limit
3. Create an inventoried package list. Event class = primary, event list type = variable, event date 
type = fixed. Link this with  inventoried event
4. Create a non-inventoried package list  Event class = primary, event list type = fixed, event date 
type = fixed. Lnk this with non-inventoried event 
5. Create a package  Link this with package lists
2. Launch the PV application
3. Navigate to Ticket Sales, sell the package
4. For package list inventoried package list don't add seats, click Continue button.
5. For non-inventoried pacakge list  lock seats so that capacity limit is reached. Complete sale 
transaction and checkout
6. In Ticket Services, return a seat from non-inventoried event
7. Verify the capacity control tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Application is launched successfully
3. 
4. 
5. Qty Sold/Reserved : capacity limit reached
6. User should be able to return
7. Qty Sold/Reserved will be reduced by the number of tickets 
returned

title: Verify that the Available count is dispalyed correctly for event as well as package in PVO availability response

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Create a Non Inventoried Package
2. Launch PVNG application
3. Login to the Application using valid credentials
4. 1. Select Ticketing Setup tab
2. Select Event Administration tab
3. Search for the Non-Inventoried event and select it
5. 1. Select the Capacity Control tab
2. Select 'Non-Inventory' from the Set Capacity For dropdown
6. Set a capacity for Price Scale1as 10 and do 
not set any limit for Price scale2
7. .Launch the Package in Ticket sales
.Verify that the Available count is dispalyed as 
blank for the price scale which do not have a limit
8. Set a limit at Event level as 2
Verify the Available Seats count displayed in the Tckets Sales page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Package should be created successfully
2. PVNG application should launch successfully
3. Login should be successful
4. Event details should be displayed
5. There should not be any default value for the 'Capacity limit' field for a non inventoried event at event level and price scale level
6. Capacity should be set
7. The Available count should be dispalyed 
as blank for the price scale which do not 
have a limit
8. Available Seats count should be displayed as 2 in the Tckets Sales page

title: Verify that the user is able to lock seats for a Non-Inventoried event if the capacity limit of the default price scale is set to zero

2. Launch PVNG application
3. Login to the Application using valid credentials

2. Select Event Administration tab
3. Search for the Non-Inventoried event and select it
5. 1. Select the Capacity Control tab
2. Select 'Non-Inventory' from the Set Capacity For dropdown
6. Set a capacity for the default Price Scale as 
10
7. Lock 2 seats for the event and complete a sale
6.Verify the Qty sold for this price scale in Event 
Administration
8. Set the quantity as 0 for the same price scale
9. Load the event in sales page
9.Verify that the default price scale is not 
displayed
10. Lock seats for the event

2. PVNG application should launch successfully
3. Login should be successful
4. Event details should be displayed
5. There should not be any default value for the 'Capacity limit' field for a non inventoried event at event level and price scale level
6. capacity should be set
7. The Qty sholud be displayed as 2
8. Limit should be set as 0
9. The default price scale Should not be displayed
10. Seats should be locked

7. 1. Select 'Exchange' from the Select Action dropdown

2. Enter number of seats that exceeds capacity limit
3. Select the buyer type
4. Select LOCK SEATS button

2. Login should be successful

2. User should be moved to cart

title: Verify that user can perform seat assignment for reserved unassigned seats of a package including deferred seating event with Total capacity percentage limit type, via Directed Assignment flow from Will Call portal even if the assigned Locks allowed

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Pre-Condition
Venue
1. Create a venue in such a way that the Total capacity of the venue is 100

Event with Deferred type
2. Create two or more than two events of type "Deferred Seating"
3. Set the Unassigned Capacity percentage limit for the event to be 80% for all the events.
4. Navigate to Event -> Event Access and Select User U1 in the context and then set the permission 'Assign Seating' to FALSE for that user U1 (navigate to the Event Access page of all the events and do the same for all events)

PackageEventList (PEL)
5.Create a PEL and associate all the deferred type events to the PEL.

Package
6.Create a Package and associate the PEL to the Package.
7.Logout from the application.
2. 1. Navigate to Ticket Sales and Select the Package and a Patron
2. Complete a Package Reservation transaction in such a way that the 'assigned Locks allowed' value becomes zero (Use Will Call as Delivery method)
3. Total Capacity
Assigned Quantity
Assigned Current Locks
Unassigned Quantity
Unassigned Current Locks
Unassigned Capacity % Limit

Unassigned Capacity
Assigned Locks Allowed
Unassigned Locks Allowed 



[ Example :-
The values should be 

Total Capacity                            100
Assigned Quantity                     100
Assigned Current Locks            0
Unassigned Quantity                  0
Unassigned Current Locks         0
Unassigned Capacity % Limit     150
        
Unassigned Capacity                  50
Assigned Locks Allowed            0
Unassigned Locks Allowed        50  ]
4. 1. Select "Directed Assignment" action.
2. Select n number of tickets and complete the transaction.
5. Try different combinations of scenarios by giving different values to get the 'unassigned Locks allowed' value as zero.

Check the below values in the LOG:-
Total Capacity
Assigned Quantity
Assigned Current Locks
Unassigned Quantity
Unassigned Current Locks
Unassigned Capacity % Limit
Unassigned Capacity
Assigned Locks Allowed
Unassigned Locks Allowed
6. Formulas to be used:

Assigned Locks Allowed = Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks - ((Unassigned Quantity + Unassigned Current Locks) * (100/Unassigned Capacity Percentage Limit))

Unassigned Locks Allowed = ((Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks) * Unassigned Capacity Percentage Limit) - Unassigned Quantity - Unassigned Current Locks

Unassigned Capacity = (Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks) * Capacity Percentage Limit (Unassigned or Total)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Pre-condition should be satisfied
2. User is able to complete a package sale transaction and get the 'assigned Locks allowed' value as zero successfully.
3. All the values should be displayed in the LOG with the correct calculation.
4. User should be able to perform seat assignment for unassigned sold/reserved seats even if the 'assigned locks allowed' value is zero
5. The values should be updated correctly in the Log
6.

title: Verify that Unssigned Qty Sold-Reserved field is increased accordingly at event level and price  scale level for a deferred seating event with Total cap limit type after selling unassigned seats for a pkg that includ

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PVNG application
2. Login to the Application using valid credentials
3. 1. Select Ticketing Setup tab
2. Select Event Administration tab
3. Search for the deferred seating event that will be used in the steps to follow and select it
4. Select the Capacity Control tab
5. Select 'Deferred Seating' from the Set Capacity For dropdown
4. 1. Select the Event Access tab
2. Select the option 'Transaction Types and Dates' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3. Select a User in Context panel
4  Set 'Assign Seating' permission to 'True'
5. Click APPLY CHANGES'
5. 1.Navigate to Package Event List portal and select the package event list for the deferred seating event
2.Navigate to Package List Access tab
3.Select the option 'General' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
4.Select a user in Context panel
5.Set the 'Assign Seating' permission to 'True' for this user
6.Click APPLY CHANGES
6. 1. Select Ticketing tab
2. Select Ticket Sales
3. Search and select the package that includes the deferred seating event
4. Search and select a patron
7. 1. Click on Selection Guide
2. Enter number of seats
3. Select the buyer type
4. Click on LOCK SEATS
5. Repeat steps 1 - 4 for each package event list in the package
8. 1. Select a delivery method
2. Select a payment method
3. Click on CHECKOUT button
9. 1. Select Ticketing Setup tab
2. Select Event Administration tab

title: Verify tht user cant lck asignd seats in cart in PRTIAL PKG XCHANGE RESRVATION,from a prticulr pricscal of DS EVT with TCPL typ, if the seat reqst count wont reslt in exceedn the ALA 4 tht pricscal but will reslt in exceedn the Asgn Lcks Alwd 4 tht e

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. VENUE
1. Create a venue V1 in such a way that the Total capacity of the venue is 100

PRICE SCALE
1. Create two Price Scales PS1 & PS2 with 50 seats each for the venue created above.
2. In Defered Seating Capacity Defaults block of the price scale PS1:-
-- Set the Percentage Limit Type as Total  Capacity
--Set the Capacity Percentage Limit for the price scale  as 150%

DEFERED SEATING EVENT
1.Create an event EVT1 of inventory type Deferred Seating with a price structure that has both the above created price scales PS1 & PS2.
2.For the event EVT1 created above:-
-- Set the Percentage Limit Type as Total  Capacity
--Set the Capacity Percentage Limit for the event  as 101%

SOURCE PACKAGE
1.Create a package PACK2 with a package event list PEL2 containing the event EVT2.
2. Create a Reservation transaction for 20 seats for the package PACK2
4. 1.Navigate to Event portal and select the event EVT1(created above)
2.Navigate to Event Access tab
2.Select the option 'General' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3.Select a user, say U1
4.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to TRUE for this user
5.Click APPLY CHANGES
5. 1.Navigate to Event portal and select the event EVT1(created above)
2.Navigate to Event Access tab
2.Select the option 'General' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3.Select a user, say U2
4.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to FALSE for this user
5.Click APPLY CHANGES
6. 1.Login as the user U2 with Unassigned sales permission.
2.Navigate to Ticket sales
3.Complete a sale/reservation transaction of 10 seats for the Event EVT1 for the price scale PS1
7. 1.Logout from the Application
2.Login as the user U1 with Assigned sales permission
8. 1.Navigate to Ticket sales
2.Complete a sale/reservation transaction of 50 seats for the Event EVT1 for the price scale PS2
9. Verify the values for the event EVT1 & price scale PS1 for below fields in log:-

Total Capacity
Assigned Quantity
Assigned Current Locks
Unassigned Quantity
Unassigned Current Locks
Unassigned Capacity % Limit

Unassigned Capacity
Assigned Locks Allowed
Unassigned Locks Allowed
10. 1.Navigate to Ticket Services
2. Select the order created for package PACK2
3.Select the action 'Partial Exchange' from Select Action dropdown 
4.Select the 10 seats for Exchange.
5.In the Partial Exchange cart, select the EVT1 as the target for exchange.
11. 1.Select the event EVT1 and select the radio button SINGLE and lock 45 seats from the Price scale PS1 

(any seats more than 41 but less than 50)
12. Verify whether a  WARNING MESSAGE is displayed to the user mentioning that limit has exceeded and seats cannot be locked for this seat request.
13. Formula Used:-

Unassigned Capacity = (Total Capacity * Total Capacity Percentage Limit) - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks

Assigned Locks Allowed = Min((Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks), (Unassigned Capacity- Unassigned Quantity - Unassigned  Current Locks))

Unassigned Locks Allowed = (Total Capacity * Total Capacity Percentage Limit) - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks - Unassigned Quantity -  Unassigned Current Locks
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. The User should be able to complete the pre-requisite successfully
4. Assign Seating' permission should be set to TRUE for this event for the user U1

(U1 can perform Assigned sales)
5. Assign Seating' permission should be set to FALSE for this event for the user U2

(U2 can perform Unassigned sales)
6. User should be able to complete Unassigned sales/Reservation transaction for 10 seats for the Event EVT1 for the price scale PS1
7. Login should be successfull
8. User should be able to complete Assigned Sales/Reservation transaction for 50 seats for the Event EVT1 for the price scale PS2
9. The values for the  event EVT1 in the log should be 

Total Capacity                                  100
Assigned Quantity                            50
Assigned Current Locks                  0
Unassigned Quantity                        10
Unassigned Current Locks               0
Unassigned Capacity % Limit        101
        
Unassigned Capacity                        51
Assigned Locks Allowed                41
Unassigned Locks Allowed            41

The values for the Price Scale PS1 in the log  should be 

Total Capacity                                    50
Assigned Quantity                              0
Assigned Current Locks                  0
Unassigned Quantity                        10
Unassigned Current Locks               0
Unassigned Capacity % Limit         150
        
Unassigned Capacity                        30
Assigned Locks Allowed                50
Unassigned Locks Allowed            30
10. User should be able to apply Exchange action on the 10 seats of package PACK2 and select the EVT1 as the target for Exchange and User should be navigated to the Best Available page of EVT1.
11. User should not be able to lock any assigned seats in cart in for any sale/reservation transactions for any particular price scale of a deferred seating event with Total capacity percentage limit type, if the seat request count does not exceed the 'assigned locks allowed' for that price scale but exceeds the 'assigned locks allowed' for that event
12. A WARNING MESSAGE should be displayed to the user mentioning that limit has exceeded and seats cannot be locked for this seat request.
13. These formulas are used for calculating the Unassigned capacity, Assigned Current locks & Unassigned Current locks

title: Verify the capacity related fields at event level and price scale level for a deferred seating MASTER EVENT with Total capacity limit type after removing few seats from the venue config

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Create a venue in such a way that the Total capacity of the venue is 100
2.Create a package PKG1 with event list PEL1 of Deferred Seating type and include a Master Event 
3.Set the Total Capacity percentage limit to 150% in Deferred Seating Master Event section
4. 1.Navigate to Package Event Admin portal and select the event EVT1(created above)
2.Navigate to Package List  Access tab
2.Select the option 'General' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3.Select a user, say U1
4.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to FALSE for this user
5.Click APPLY CHANGES
5. 1.Logout from the Application

custom_steps_separated.content:

2. Select Event Administration tab
3. Search for the deferred seating event sold to above and select it
12. 1. Select the Capacity Control tab
2. Select 'Deferred Seating' from the Set Capacity For dropdown

title: Verify whether any warning message is displayed when removing(disabling) seats from a venue config if it results in a case where  Assigned Locks Allowed value for a deferred seating MASTER EVENT with Total capacity limit type drops to a negative valu

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Create a venue in such a way that the Total capacity of the venue is 100
2.Create a package PKG1 with event list PEL1 of type deferred seating and include a master event.
3.Set the Total Capacity percentage limit  to 150% in Deferred Seating Master Event section
4. 1.Navigate to Package Event List portal and select the event EVT1(created above)
2.Navigate to Event Access tab
2.Select the option 'General' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3.Select a user, say U1
4.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to TRUE for this user
5.Click APPLY CHANGES
5. 1.Logout from the Application
2.Login as the user U1 mentioned in previous step
6. Perform a sale transaction for 20 seats for the package PKG1 and complete the transaction and note the order id
7. 1.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to FALSE for a user U2 for the package event list PEL1
2.Logout and login as the user U2
3.Navigate to Ticket sales and select the same package PKG1
4.Perform a sale transaction with 25 seats for user U2
8. Verfiy the below values in logs

Total Capacity
Assigned Quantity
Assigned Current Locks
Unassigned Quantity
Unassigned Current Locks
Total Capacity % Limit

Unassigned Capacity
Assigned Locks Allowed
Unassigned Locks Allowed in logs.
9. Verify that if 72 seats are removed from total capacity, the Assigned Locks Allowed' or  'Unassigned Locks Allowed' value should not be negative.

Put the values in below formulae or use the deferred seating excel sheet calculations to derive the values.
Assigned Locks Allowed = Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks - ((Unassigned Quantity + Unassigned Current Locks) * (100/Unassigned Capacity Percentage Limit))

Unassigned Locks Allowed = ((Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks) * Unassigned Capacity Percentage Limit) - Unassigned Quantity - Unassigned Current Locks
10. Login with User U1 and Navigate to Venue Administration and selelct the Supplier
11. 1.Select the Venue as same as mentioned in step1.
2.Navigate to Master Configurations tab and click on Designer button
3.Select the Seat Map and select Venue Configuration from drop down
12. 1.Remove(disable) 72 seats and click on Save button
2.Verify whether any warning message is displayed when removing(disabling) seats from a venue config
3.Verify user is able to save the changes
13. Logout from the application
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. The package should be created and the values should be set correctly
4. Assign Seating' permission should be set to TRUE for this package event list for the user U1
5. Login should be successfull
6. Transaction should be completed and order id should be noted.
7. Transaction should be completed
8. The values should be 

Total Capacity                               100
Assigned Quantity                          25
Assigned Current Locks                 0
Unassigned Quantity                       20
Unassigned Current Locks               0
Unassigned Capacity % Limit          150
        
Unassigned Capacity                       150
Assigned Locks Allowed                 100
Unassigned Locks Allowed              150
9. The Assigned Locks Allowed' or  'Unassigned Locks Allowed' value should not be negative.

From DS calculations:
Total Capacity                                 28
Assigned Quantity                          25
Assigned Current Locks                 0
Unassigned Quantity                       20
Unassigned Current Locks               0
Total Capacity % Limit                     150
        
Unassigned Capacity                       17
Assigned Locks Allowed                 -3
Unassigned Locks Allowed             -3
10. User should able to navigate to the Venue administration page
11. 1.User should be able to select the same vanue as mentioned in step1
2.User should be navigated to Venue designer page
3.User should be able to select the seat map and venue configurtation
12. A warning message should be displayed as 
"Changes to the venue configuration have resulted in more seats sold/reserved for one or more 'Deferred Seating' events than are eligible for assignment."

User should be able to save the changes
13. Logout should be successfull

6. Perform a sale transaction for 20 seats for the event EVT1 and complete the transaction and note the order id
7. 1.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to FALSE for a user U2 for the event EVT1
2.Logout and login as the user U2
3.Navigate to Ticket sales and select the same event EVT1
4.Perform a sale transaction with 25 seats for user U2
8. Verfiy the below values in logs

Total Capacity
Assigned Quantity
Assigned Current Locks
Unassigned Quantity
Unassigned Current Locks
Unassigned Capacity % Limit

Unassigned Capacity
Assigned Locks Allowed
Unassigned Locks Allowed in logs.
9. Verify that if 72 seats are removed from total capacity, the Assigned Locks Allowed' or  'Unassigned Locks Allowed' value should not be negative.

Put the values in below formulae or use the deferred seating excel sheet calculations to derive the values.
Assigned Locks Allowed = Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks - ((Unassigned Quantity + Unassigned Current Locks) * (100/Unassigned Capacity Percentage Limit))

Unassigned Locks Allowed = ((Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks) * Unassigned Capacity Percentage Limit) - Unassigned Quantity - Unassigned Current Locks
10. Login with User U1 and Navigate to Venue Administration and selelct the Supplier
11. 1.Select the Venue as same as mentioned in step1.
2.Navigate to Master Configurations tab and click on Designer button
3.Select the Seat Map and select Venue Configuration from drop down
12. 1.Remove(disable) 25 seats and click on Save button
2.Verify whether any warning message is displayed when removing(disabling) seats from a venue config
3.Verify user is able to save the changes
13. Logout from the application
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. The event should be created and the values should be set correctly
4. Assign Seating' permission should be set to TRUE for this event for the user U1
5. Login should be successfull
6. Transaction should be completed and order id should be noted.
7. Transaction should be completed
8. The values should be 

Total Capacity                               100
Assigned Quantity                          25
Assigned Current Locks                 0
Unassigned Quantity                       20
Unassigned Current Locks               0
Unassigned Capacity % Limit          80
        
Unassigned Capacity                       60
Assigned Locks Allowed                 50
Unassigned Locks Allowed             40
9. The Assigned Locks Allowed' or  'Unassigned Locks Allowed' value should not be negative.

From DS calculations:
Total Capacity                                28
Assigned Quantity                         25
Assigned Current Locks                0
Unassigned Quantity                      20
Unassigned Current Locks              0
Total Capacity % Limit                    150
        
Unassigned Capacity                      17
Assigned Locks Allowed                -3
Unassigned Locks Allowed             -3
10. User should able to navigate to the Venue administration page
11. 1.User should be able to select the same vanue as mentioned in step1
2.User should be navigated to Venue designer page
3.User should be able to select the seat map and venue configurtation
12. A warning message should be displayed as 
"Changes to the venue configuration have resulted in more seats sold/reserved for one or more 'Deferred Seating' events than are eligible for assignment."

User should be able to save the changes
13. Logout should be successfull

title: Verify whether any warning msg is displd when removing(disabling) seats from a venue config that is used by some deferred seating events with TCLT, but will not result in a case where  Asgnd Lks Alwd or  Unasgnd Lks value dropping to a negative numbe

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Launch PV Application
2. Login to the Application using suitable credentials
3. 1.Create a venue in such a way that the Total capacity of the venue is 100
2.Create an event EVT1 of type deferred seating

3.Set the Total Capacity percentage limit for the event to 150%
4. 1.Navigate to Event portal and select the event EVT1(created above)
2.Navigate to Event Access tab
2.Select the option 'General' from the "Set/Modify" dropdown
3.Select a user, say U1
4.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to FALSE for this user
5.Click APPLY CHANGES
5. 1.Logout from the Application
2.Login as the user U1 mentioned in previous step
6. Perform a sale transaction for 20 seats for the event EVT1 and complete the transaction and note the order id
7. 1.Set the permission 'Assign Seating' to TRUE for a user U2 for the event EVT1
2.Logout and login as the user U2
3.Navigate to Ticket sales and select the same event EVT1
4.Perform a sale transaction with 25 seats for user U2
8. Verfiy the below values in logs

Total Capacity
Assigned Quantity
Assigned Current Locks
Unassigned Quantity
Unassigned Current Locks
Unassigned Capacity % Limit

Unassigned Capacity
Assigned Locks Allowed
Unassigned Locks Allowed in logs.
9. Verify that if 25 seats are removed from total capacity, the Assigned Locks Allowed' or  'Unassigned Locks Allowed' value should not be negative.

Put the values in below formulae or use the deferred seating excel sheet calculations to derive the values.
Assigned Locks Allowed = Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks - ((Unassigned Quantity + Unassigned Current Locks) * (100/Unassigned Capacity Percentage Limit))

Unassigned Locks Allowed = ((Total Capacity - Assigned Quantity - Assigned Current Locks) * Unassigned Capacity Percentage Limit) - Unassigned Quantity - Unassigned Current Locks
10. Login with User U1 and Navigate to Venue Administration and selelct the Supplier
11. 1.Select the Venue as same as mentioned in step1.
2.Navigate to Master Configurations tab and click on Designer button
3.Select the Seat Map and select Venue Configuration from drop down
12. 1.Remove(disable) 25 seats and click on Save button
2.Verify whether any warning message is displayed when removing(disabling) seats from a venue config
13. Logout from the application
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. PV Application should be launched successfully
2. Login should be successful
3. The event should be created and the values should be set correctly
4. Assign Seating' permission should be set to FALSE for this event for the user U1
5. Login should be successfull
6. Transaction should be completed and order id should be noted.
7. Transaction should be completed
8. The values should be 

Total Capacity                               100
Assigned Quantity                          25
Assigned Current Locks                 0
Unassigned Quantity                       20
Unassigned Current Locks               0
Unassigned Capacity % Limit          80
        
Unassigned Capacity                       60
Assigned Locks Allowed                 50
Unassigned Locks Allowed             40
9. The Assigned Locks Allowed' or  'Unassigned Locks Allowed' value should not be negative.

From DS calculations:
Total Capacity                                75
Assigned Quantity                          25
Assigned Current Locks                 0
Unassigned Quantity                       20
Unassigned Current Locks               0
Unassigned Capacity % Limit          80
        
Unassigned Capacity                       40
Assigned Locks Allowed                 25
Unassigned Locks Allowed              20
10. User should able to navigate to the Venue administration page
11. 1.User should be able to select the same vanue as mentioned in step1
2.User should be navigated to Venue designer page
3.User should be able to select the seat map and venue configurtation
12. NO warning message should be displayed when removing seats from the venue config
13. Logout should be successfull
